questions.question_text: How many cloud gateway instance(s) can be created per region when provisioning Cloud OnRamp for Multicloud from AWS in a multiregion environment?

discussion.content: A Only one cloud gateway per region

A
Only one cloud gateway per region can be created.
The link refer to:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/cloudonramp/ios-xe-17/cloud-onramp-book-xe/cloud-onramp-multi-cloud-aws.html#:~:text=Only%20one%20cloud%20gateway%20per,configuration%20groups%20are%20not%20supported.

questions.question_text: Which two image formats are supported for controller codes? (Choose two.)
What does forward error correction addresses in Cisco SD-WAN?

choices.A: reduced application performance degradation related to service degradation
choices.C: traffic flows with increased delay over a particular transport
choices.D: inefficient traffic forwarding caused by inbound shapers
choices.B: applications with occasional invalid data input and poor performance

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A
Forward Error Correction (FEC) is a mechanism to recover lost packets on a link by sending extra “parity” packets for every group of 4 packets. As long as the receiver receives a subset of packets in the group (at-least N-1) and the parity packet, up to a single lost packet in the group can be recovered

questions.question_text: Which process is continued by Cisco SD-WAN when packet duplication is enabled?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
See link below:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/policies/ios-xe-17/policies-book-xe/packet-duplication.html#:~:text=Packet%20duplication%20sends%20copies%20of,one%20packet%20to%20the%20server.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

choices.A: Additional headers are added to outgoing packets to perform custom routing policies.
choices.D: Application traffic is analyzed to find patterns and enable custom detection rules.
choices.B: Dynamic traffic is compressed and signaled before it is forwarded though the WAN.
choices.C: Copies of packets are sent over multiple WAN circuits to overcome packet loss.

choices.A: It provides information about configured optimization policies on SD-WAN edge devices.
choices.D: It provides configuration and monitoring for WAAS nodes.
choices.B: It accelerates specific traffic based on preconfigured policies.
choices.C: It intercepts and distributes network traffic based on configured policies.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct
AppNav Controller: A device that intercepts network traffic and, based on an AppNav policy, distributes that traffic to one or more WAAS nodes (WNs) for optimization. The device in this context is a Cisco IOS XE Catalyst SD-WAN device running AppNav-XE
https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&opi=89978449&url=https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/appqoe/ios-xe-17/appqoe-book-xe/m-appnav-xe-for-sd-wan.html&ved=2ahUKEwimo9SPxoaFAxVx8gIHHbNWCmcQFnoECBIQAw&usg=AOvVaw3E4liSvijdoSHz9CrYBsko

questions.question_text: What is the function of the AppNav Controller in the Cisco SD-WAN AppNav solution?
